text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "What I took away from my five or six days on a film set with Bannon was a feeling of his destructive impulses. His is not an ideology of making things; it is an ideology of pure destruction." @errolmorris's latest: https://t.co/WPAPDD948D

name: TheAtlantic
text: COVID-19 vaccines can be tested in monkeys, but U.S. researchers don't have enough, and China has shut off exports. @sarahzhang reports: https://t.co/TcJ5bR0mSn

text: RT @mckaycoppins: Utah, which has been voting by mail for years, has gotten used to not knowing the outcome of tight elections for several days. Utah‚Äôs Republican LG tells me the rest of the country needs that ‚Äúparadigm shift.‚Äù https://t.co/cjT0HJsGln https://t.co/uIiUDOlo2T

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Following months of turbulence, more than a dozen journalists for the Voice of America have signed a letter of protest against their parent agency's new CEO, Michael Pack.
In June, @anneapplebaum detailed Pack's "unprecedented" actions: https://t.co/pREvn5fWCP
